alert.note: Alert for Western Alaska Range (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 09 at 1:28PM AKDT until June 09 at 10:00PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM AKDT THIS EVENING FOR LIGHTNING FOR THE WESTERN SLOPE OF THE WESTERN ALASKA RANGE... * Timing...Thunderstorm activity will continue until 10 PM. * Location...Western Slope of the Western Alaska Range. Storms may move over Nondalton and Port Alsworth. * Lightning Activity Level...4 (Scattered Wet Thunderstorms) * Winds...Northwest 5 to 10 mph. Up to 20 mph on the foothills west of the Western Alaska Range and variable gusts to 25 mph near thunderstorms. * Relative Humidity...As low as 30 percent in valley areas. * Temperatures...60 to 70 degrees. 50s over higher, snow free elevations. * Impacts...Ample lightning could lead to numerous new fire starts.
info.instruction: A red flag warning means that critical fire weather conditions are imminent or occurring now, or will shortly. It is directed toward fire agencies, and through them to the public.
